DataElement.preferredName: Histologic Involvement Bone Marrow Present Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the histologic involvement in bone marrow.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to the combined microscopic physical features of cells and their surrounding extracellular environment in tissues._To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process._The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes._Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to the combined microscopic physical features of cells and their surrounding extracellular environment in tissues.
To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.
The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to the combined microscopic physical features of cells and their surrounding extracellular environment in tissues._To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The quality or state of being able to assume different forms.

Concepts.definition: The quality or state of being able to assume different forms.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A clonal neoplasm of small B-lymphocytes, lymphoplasmacytoid cells, and plasma cells involving the bone marrow, lymph nodes, and the spleen. The majority of patients have a serum IgM paraprotein.

Concepts.definition: A clonal neoplasm of small B-lymphocytes, lymphoplasmacytoid cells, and plasma cells involving the bone marrow, lymph nodes, and the spleen. The majority of patients have a serum IgM paraprotein.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A mononuclear cell slightly larger than a small lymphocyte with an eccentric dark nucleus. It has basophilic cytoplasm and secretes immunoglobulins.  It may contain intranuclear cytoplasmic inclusions (Dutcher bodies) which are PAS-positive.

Concepts.definition: A mononuclear cell slightly larger than a small lymphocyte with an eccentric dark nucleus. It has basophilic cytoplasm and secretes immunoglobulins.  It may contain intranuclear cytoplasmic inclusions (Dutcher bodies) which are PAS-positive.
